subject: Re: [junit] Testing same API - Different Inputs
msgSnippet: Hi Rajneesh! To make these test as independent as possible, you could create input file using File.createNewFile() and fill the same with the test inputs and
messageBody:
Hi Rajneesh!

To make these test as independent as possible, you could create input
file using File.createNewFile() and fill the same with the test inputs
and then call these methods to use the input from these temp file (you
many need to modifiy your code to accept the file name rather than it
assuming the hardcoded config file name).

For the 2nd question to run the same test multiple times, You could use
http://www.clarkware.com/software/JUnitPerf.html api.

Regards,
Nagedra


J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> rajneesh_jindia179 wrote:
>
> > Hi all
> > Do we have a way out by which we can test the same API with a
> > different set of inputs.(inputs to be picked up from a text file)
> > I am looking for an alternative to creating a new testSCENARIO()
> > method for each scene.
> >
> > test_CORRECT_DATA()
> > test_INVALID_DATA()
> >
> > Both of these are going to perform the same stuff internally.
> >
> > Do we have a way by which we can specify.. run this testMethod() 10
> > times, this one 5 times.
>
> You want something called the Parameterized Test Case pattern. See
> _JUnit Recipes_, recipe 4.8. The e-book is only USD 25 and available now
> at www.manning.com/rainsberger
> --
> J. B. Rainsberger,
